thm climserle(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  โข (w0 โ(seq(c0(+, c1))` c2)[โค]c3)
  โฃ c4 =(โคโฅ ` c0)
  โฃ (w0 โ c2 โ c4)
  โฃ (w0 โ seq(c0(+, c1))[~~>]c3)
  โฃ ((w0 โง s0 โ c4)โ(c1 ` s0)โ โ)
  โฃ ((w0 โง s0 โ c4)โ 0[โค](c1 ` s0))
  โฃ d(s0, c0)
  โฃ d(s0, c1)
  โฃ d(s0, c2)
  โฃ d(s0, c3)
  โฃ d(s0, c4)
  โฃ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 โ(seq(c0(+, c1))` c2)[โค]c3), d(s0, c2))
  a1ii((w0 โ(seq(c0(+, c1))` c2)[โค]c3), d(s0, c3))
  climub(hs0, seq(c0(+, c1)), c2, c3, c4, c0, w0)
  breqtrrd((seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0), cle, (seq(c0(+, c1))`(hs0[+]1)), ((seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0)[+](c1 `(hs0[+]1))), (w0 โง hs0 โ c4))
  mpbid((w0 โง hs0 โ c4), (seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0)[โค]((seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0)[+](c1 `(hs0[+]1))), 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1)))
  sylan2(w0, hs0 โ c4, 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1)), (hs0[+]1)โ c4)
  impcom(w0, (hs0[+]1)โ c4, 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1)))
  vtoclga(s0, (hs0[+]1), c4, (w0 โ 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1))), (w0 โ 0[โค](c1 ` s0)))
  imbi2d(s0 =(hs0[+]1), w0, 0[โค](c1 ` s0), 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1)))
  breq2d(nat0, cle, (c1 ` s0), (c1 `(hs0[+]1)), s0 =(hs0[+]1))
  expcom(s0 โ c4, w0, 0[โค](c1 ` s0))
  addge01d((c1 `(hs0[+]1)), (seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0), (w0 โง hs0 โ c4))
  ffvelrnda(hs0, c4, seq(c0(+, c1)), cr, w0)
  serfre(s0, c0, c1, c4, w0)
  syl(w0, c0 โ โค, c2 โ(โคโฅ ` c0))
  syl6eleq(c2, (โคโฅ ` c0), c4, w0)
  eluzel2(c2, c0)
  sylan2(w0, hs0 โ c4, (c1 `(hs0[+]1))โ โ, (hs0[+]1)โ c4)
  peano2uzs(hs0, c4, c0)
  impcom(w0, (hs0[+]1)โ c4, (c1 `(hs0[+]1))โ โ)
  vtoclga(s0, (hs0[+]1), c4, (w0 โ(c1 `(hs0[+]1))โ โ), (w0 โ(c1 ` s0)โ โ))
  imbi2d(s0 =(hs0[+]1), w0, (c1 ` s0)โ โ, (c1 `(hs0[+]1))โ โ)
  eleq1d((c1 ` s0), cr, (c1 `(hs0[+]1)), s0 =(hs0[+]1))
  fveq2(s0, (hs0[+]1), c1)
  expcom(s0 โ c4, w0, (c1 ` s0)โ โ)
  syl((w0 โง hs0 โ c4), (seq(c0(+, c1))`(hs0[+]1))=((seq(c0(+, c1))` hs0)[+](c1 `(hs0[+]1))), hs0 โ(โคโฅ ` c0))
  syl6eleq(hs0, (โคโฅ ` c0), c4, (w0 โง hs0 โ c4))
  simpr(w0, hs0 โ c4)
  seqp1(hs0, c0, caddc, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(seq(c0(+, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, 0[โค](c1 `(hs0[+]1)))
  diff.wbr.s(s0, nat0, cle, (c1 `(hs0[+]1)))
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cle.s(s0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, (c1 `(hs0[+]1))โ โ)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, (c1 `(hs0[+]1)), cr)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, (hs0[+]1))
  diff.co.s(s0, hs0, caddc, nat1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cr.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: isershft
blocks.content: Index shift of the limit of an infinite series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Sep-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm isershft(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cli, c4), wbr(cseq(co(c0, caddc, c1), c2, co(c3, cshi, c1)), cli, c4)))
  -| wcel(c3, universe)
} = {
  bitr2d(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cli, c4), wbr(cseq(co(c0, caddc, c1), c2, co(c3, cshi, c1)), cli, c4), wbr(co(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cshi, c1), cli, c4))
  breq1d(cseq(co(c0, caddc, c1), c2, co(c3, cshi, c1)), cli, c4, co(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cshi, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  eqtrd(cseq(co(c0, caddc, c1), c2, co(c3, cshi, c1)), co(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cshi, c1), co(cseq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c2, c3), cshi, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  sylancom(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(cseq(co(c0, caddc, c1), c2, co(c3, cshi, c1)), co(cseq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c2, c3), cshi, c1)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cz))
  zaddcl(c0, c1)
  seqshft(co(c0, caddc, c1), c1, c2, c3)
  oveq1d(cseq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c2, c3), cshi, c1, cseq(c0, c2, c3), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  seqeq1d(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c2, c3, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  zcn(c0)
  zcn(c1)
  pncan(c0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(co(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cshi, c1), cli, c4), wbr(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cli, c4)))
  mpan2(wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(co(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cshi, c1), cli, c4), wbr(cseq(c0, c2, c3), cli, c4)), wcel(cseq(c0, c2, c3), universe))
  seqex(c0, c2, c3)
  climshft(c1, cseq(c0, c2, c3), universe, c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm isershft(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  โข ((c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค)โ(seq(c0(c2, c3))[~~>]c4 โ seq((c0[+]c1)(c2,(c3[shift]c1)))[~~>]c4))
  โฃ c3 โ ๐
} = {
  bitr2d((c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค), seq(c0(c2, c3))[~~>]c4, seq((c0[+]c1)(c2,(c3[shift]c1)))[~~>]c4, (seq(c0(c2, c3))[shift]c1)[~~>]c4)
  breq1d(seq((c0[+]c1)(c2,(c3[shift]c1))), cli, c4, (seq(c0(c2, c3))[shift]c1), (c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค))
  eqtrd(seq((c0[+]c1)(c2,(c3[shift]c1))), (seq(c0(c2, c3))[shift]c1), (seq(((c0[+]c1)[-]c1)(c2, c3))[shift]c1), (c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค))
  sylancom(c0 โ โค, c1 โ โค, seq((c0[+]c1)(c2,(c3[shift]c1)))=(seq(((c0[+]c1)[-]c1)(c2, c3))[shift]c1), (c0[+]c1)โ โค)
  zaddcl(c0, c1)
  seqshft((c0[+]c1), c1, c2, c3)
  oveq1d(seq(((c0[+]c1)[-]c1)(c2, c3)), cshi, c1, seq(c0(c2, c3)), (c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค))
  seqeq1d(((c0[+]c1)[-]c1), c2, c3, c0, (c0 โ โค โง c1 โ โค))
  syl2an(c0 โ โค, c1 โ โค, ((c0[+]c1)[-]c1)= c0, c0 โ โ, c1 โ โ)
  zcn(c0)
  zcn(c1)
  pncan(c0, c1)
  adantl(c0 โ โค, c1 โ โค, ((seq(c0(c2, c3))[shift]c1)[~~>]c4 โ seq(c0(c2, c3))[~~>]c4))
  mpan2(c1 โ โค, ((seq(c0(c2, c3))[shift]c1)[~~>]c4 โ seq(c0(c2, c3))[~~>]c4), seq(c0(c2, c3))โ ๐)
  seqex(c0, c2, c3)
  climshft(c1, seq(c0(c2, c3)), universe, c4)
}

blocks.name: isercolllem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ isercoll . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isercolllem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wss(c0, cn)), wiso(cres(c1, c0), clt, clt, c0, cima(c1, c0)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, cn, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cn)), wbr(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), clt, cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wss(c0, cn)), wiso(cres(c1, c0), clt, clt, c0, cima(c1, c0))), wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wss(c0, cn)), wiso(cres(c1, c0), clt, clt, c0, cima(c1, c0))), diffsc(s0, c3))

blocks.name: isercoll2
blocks.content: Generalize ~ isercoll so that both sequences have arbitrary starting point. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: climsup
blocks.content: A bounded monotonic sequence converges to the supremum of its range. Theorem 12-5.1 of [Gleason] p. 180. (Contributed by NM, 13-Mar-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm climsup(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, csup(crn(c0), cr, clt)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cle, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s1, cr, wral(s0, c1, wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cle, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wbr(c0, cli, csup(crn(c0), cr, clt)), wral(hs0, crp, wrex(hs1, c1, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, csup(crn(c0), cr, clt))), clt, cv(hs0))))))
  ralrimiva(hs0, crp, w0, wrex(hs1, c1, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, csup(crn(c0), cr, clt))), clt, cv(hs0)))))
  mpd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crp)), wrex(hs1, c1, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, csup(crn(c0), cr, clt))), clt, cv(hs0)))), wrex(hs1, c1, wbr(co(csup(crn(c0), cr, clt), cmin, cv(hs0)), clt, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))

blocks.name: climcau
blocks.content: A converging sequence of complex numbers is a Cauchy sequence. Theorem 12-5.3 of [Gleason] p. 180 (necessity part). (Contributed by NM, 16-Apr-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2014.)

blocks.name: climbdd
blocks.content: A converging sequence of complex numbers is bounded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2017.)

blocks.name: caurcvgr
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of real numbers converges to its limit supremum. The third hypothesis specifies that ` F ` is a Cauchy sequence. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-May-2016.) (Revised by AV, 12-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: caucvgr
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of complex numbers converges to a complex number. Theorem 12-5.3 of [Gleason] p. 180 (sufficiency part). (Contributed by NM, 20-Dec-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm caucvgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(crli)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  syl(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(crli)), wbr(c0, crli, co(cfv(crli, ccom(cre, c0)), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cfv(crli, ccom(cim, c0))))))
  eqbrtrd(c0, crli, co(cfv(crli, ccom(cre, c0)), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cfv(crli, ccom(cim, c0)))), cmpt(hs0, c1, co(cfv(cre, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cfv(cim, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))), w0)
  eqtrd(c0, cmpt(hs0, c1, co(cfv(cre, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cfv(cim, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))), cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c1, cc, w0)

blocks.name: caurcvg
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of real numbers converges to its limit supremum. The fourth hypothesis specifies that ` F ` is a Cauchy sequence. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2005.) (Revised by AV, 12-Sep-2020.)

  reximia(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))

  1rp()
  r19.2z(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))

blocks.name: caucvg
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of complex numbers converges to a complex number. Theorem 12-5.3 of [Gleason] p. 180 (sufficiency part). (Contributed by NM, 20-Dec-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-May-2016.)

blocks.name: caucvgb
blocks.content: A function is convergent if and only if it is Cauchy. Theorem 12-5.3 of [Gleason] p. 180. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: serf0
blocks.content: If an infinite series converges, its underlying sequence converges to zero. (Contributed by NM, 2-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: iseraltlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . A decreasing sequence with limit zero consists of positive terms. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: iseraltlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . The terms of an alternating series form a chain of inequalities in alternate terms, so that for example ` S ( 1 ) <_ S ( 3 ) <_ S ( 5 ) <_ ... ` and ` ... <_ S ( 4 ) <_ S ( 2 ) <_ S ( 0 ) ` (assuming ` M = 0 ` so that these terms are defined). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: iseraltlem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . From ~ iseraltlem2 , we have ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) ` and ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) ` , and we also have ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) - G ( n + 1 ) ` for each ` n ` by the definition of the partial sum ` S ` , so combining the inequalities we get ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) - G ( n + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) - G ( n + 2 k + 1 ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) + G ( n + 1 ) ` , so ` | ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) - ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) | = ` ` | S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) - S ( n ) | <_ G ( n + 1 ) ` and ` | ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) - ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) | = ` ` | S ( n + 2 k ) - S ( n ) | <_ G ( n + 1 ) ` . Thus, both even and odd partial sums are Cauchy if ` G ` converges to ` 0 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: iseralt
blocks.content: The alternating series test. If ` G ( k ) ` is a decreasing sequence that converges to ` 0 ` , then ` sum_ k e. Z ( -u 1 ^ k ) x. G ( k ) ` is a convergent series. (Note that the first term is positive if ` M ` is even, and negative if ` M ` is odd. If the parity of your series does not match up with this, you will need to post-compose the series with multiplication by ` -u 1 ` using ~ isermulc2 .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 9-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:
